meanings.definition: A person or thing that pumps.
meanings.sent1: The pumpers worked hard to drain the water from the flooded basement.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic used the pumpers to inflate the tires of the car.
meanings.sent3: The little boy pretended to be one of the pumpers at the gas station.
meanings.sent4: Her heart beat like a team of pumpers, pushing blood through her veins.
meanings.sent5: The pumpers in the factory kept the production line running smoothly.

meanings.sent1: The old pumpers in the garden helped water the plants efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter carried the heavy pumpers to extinguish the fire.
meanings.sent3: The pumpers in the gym made funny noises when they were turned on.
meanings.sent4: The pumpers hummed softly, moving water from one place to another.
meanings.sent5: The pumpers at the gas station were painted bright red for visibility.

meanings.definition: A group of people who engage in pumping activities.
meanings.sent1: The enthusiastic pumpers cheered each other on during the competition.
meanings.sent2: The dedicated pumpers gathered every morning for their workout session.
meanings.sent3: The pumpers at the party danced to the music with great energy.
meanings.sent4: The pumpers in the team synchronized their movements perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The pumpers in the club shared tips and tricks for better performance.
